file_insights.changes_summary: Added checklist_templates module to imports and registered its router with api_router

specific_changes.detail: Added checklist_templates to the module imports from app.api.v1

patterns_discovered.description: Consistent pattern of importing modules and registering their routers with matching tags
Central router file aggregates all sub-routers from different feature modules
examples: All 11 modules (projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, files, audit, auth, checklist_templates) are imported and registered in single location

patterns_discovered.description: Modules appear to be roughly organized alphabetically in imports and registrations
examples: Import order: projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, files, audit, auth, checklist_templates

gotchas_discovered.description: The checklist_templates module must already exist in app/api/v1/ for this import to work
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure app/api/v1/checklist_templates.py exists with a router object defined

gotchas_discovered.description: The tags parameter uses the module name as-is (with underscore), which may affect API documentation formatting
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify tag naming is consistent with project conventions and API documentation requirements

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully integrated checklist_templates module into the v1 API router
approach_outcome.implementation_approach: Followed established patterns by adding the new module to the centralized router composition file
approach_outcome.completeness: Task completed in single attempt with clean, minimal changes

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that app/api/v1/checklist_templates.py exists and exports a router object before deploying
recommendations.rationale: Import will fail at runtime if the module does not exist

recommendations.recommendation: Document the router registration pattern in project guidelines
recommendations.rationale: Helps future developers understand the convention for adding new API modules

recommendations.recommendation: Consider using a registry pattern if the number of routers continues to grow
recommendations.rationale: Would reduce boilerplate in the central router file as the API expands
